channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GUI-explorer: Autonomous Exploration and Mining of Transition-aware Knowledge for GUI Agent
item.description: GUI automation faces critical challenges in dynamic environments.

item.title: Sufficient conditions for offline reactivation in recurrent neural networks
item.description: During periods of quiescence, such as sleep, neural activity in many brain circuits resembles that observed during periods of task engagement.

item.title: SpatialScore: Towards Unified Evaluation for Multimodal Spatial Understanding
item.description: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) have achieved impressive success in question-answering tasks, yet their capabilities for spatial understanding are less explored.

item.title: FoMoH: A clinically meaningful foundation model evaluation for structured electronic health records
item.description: Foundation models hold significant promise in healthcare, given their capacity to extract meaningful representations independent of downstream tasks.

item.title: PromptTAD: Object-Prompt Enhanced Traffic Anomaly Detection
item.description: Previous frame-level methods are often vulnerable to interference from these dynamic backgrounds and struggle to detect small objects located at a distance or off-center.

item.title: ICYM2I: The illusion of multimodal informativeness under missingness
item.description: Multimodal learning is of continued interest in artificial intelligence-based applications, motivated by the potential information gain from combining different types of data.

item.title: CoNav: Collaborative Cross-Modal Reasoning for Embodied Navigation
item.description: Embodied navigation demands comprehensive scene understanding and precise spatial reasoning.

item.title: EquivPruner: Boosting Efficiency and Quality in LLM-Based Search via Action Pruning
item.description: To address this, we propose EquivPruner, a simple yet effective approach that identifies and prunes semantically equivalent actions during LLM reasoning search.

item.title: LINEA: Fast and Accurate Line Detection Using Scalable Transformers
item.description: This paper develops a new transformer-based method that is significantly faster without requiring pretraining the attention mechanism on large datasets.

item.title: AppealCase: A Dataset and Benchmark for Civil Case Appeal Scenarios
item.description: Recent advances in LegalAI have primarily focused on individual case judgment analysis, often overlooking the critical appellate process within the judicial system.

item.title: Forward-only Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: This work presents a forward-only diffusion (FoD) approach for generative modelling.

item.title: Walk&Retrieve: Simple Yet Effective Zero-shot Retrieval-Augmented Generation via Knowledge Graph Walks
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have showcased impressive reasoning abilities, but often suffer from hallucinations or outdated knowledge.

item.title: ConvSearch-R1: Enhancing Query Reformulation for Conversational Search with Reasoning via Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Conversational search systems require effective handling of context-dependent queries that often contain ambiguity, omission, and coreference.

item.title: Are the confidence scores of reviewers consistent with the review content? Evidence from top conference proceedings in AI
item.description: Peer review is vital in academia for evaluating research quality.

item.title: InstructSAM: A Training-Free Framework for Instruction-Oriented Remote Sensing Object Recognition
item.description: We believe the contributions of the proposed tasks, benchmark, and effective approach will advance future research in developing versatile object recognition systems.

item.title: DiffProb: Data Pruning for Face Recognition
item.description: Face recognition models have made substantial progress due to advances in deep learning and the availability of large-scale datasets.

item.title: Decoding Phone Pairs from MEG Signals Across Speech Modalities
item.description: Understanding the neural mechanisms underlying speech production is essential for both advancing cognitive neuroscience theory and developing practical communication technologies.

item.title: Reliable Vertical Federated Learning in 5G Core Network Architecture
item.description: This work proposes a new algorithm to mitigate model generalization loss in Vertical Federated Learning (VFL) operating under client reliability constraints within 5G Core Networks (CNs).

item.title: Keep Security! Benchmarking Security Policy Preservation in Large Language Model Contexts Against Indirect Attacks in Question Answering
item.description: As Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed in sensitive domains such as enterprise and government, ensuring that they adhere to user-defined security policies within context is critical-especially with respect to information non-disclosure.

item.title: Linear Convergence of Plug-and-Play Algorithms with Kernel Denoisers
item.description: The focus of this work is on the convergence of PnP iterates for linear inverse problems using kernel denoisers.

item.title: Human in the Loop Adaptive Optimization for Improved Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Time series forecasting models often produce systematic, predictable errors even in critical domains such as energy, finance, and healthcare.

item.title: Responsible Diffusion Models via Constraining Text Embeddings within Safe Regions
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel self-discovery approach to identifying a semantic direction vector in the embedding space to restrict text embedding within a safe region.

item.title: Transfer of Structural Knowledge from Synthetic Languages
item.description: We also introduce a new synthetic language that leads to better transfer to English than the languages used in previous research.

item.title: Alignment Under Pressure: The Case for Informed Adversaries When Evaluating LLM Defenses
item.description: Our results show that, contrary to previous beliefs, effective adversarial suffixes do exist against SOTA alignment-based defenses, that these can be found by existing attack methods when adversaries exploit alignment knowledge, and that even universal suffixes exist.

item.title: Leveraging Unit Language Guidance to Advance Speech Modeling in Textless Speech-to-Speech Translation
item.description: We propose the unit language to overcome the two modeling challenges.

item.title: The Atlas of In-Context Learning: How Attention Heads Shape In-Context Retrieval Augmentation
item.description: Large language models are able to exploit in-context learning to access external knowledge beyond their training data through retrieval-augmentation.

item.title: ThinkRec: Thinking-based recommendation via LLM
item.description: Motivated by this, we propose ThinkRec, a thinking-based framework that shifts LLM4Rec from System 1 to System 2 (rational system).

item.title: Objective Bicycle Occlusion Level Classification using a Deformable Parts-Based Model
item.description: A novel method of bicycle occlusion level is proposed to objectively quantify the visibility and occlusion level of bicycle semantic parts.

item.title: iPad: Iterative Proposal-centric End-to-End Autonomous Driving
item.description: End-to-end (E2E) autonomous driving systems offer a promising alternative to traditional modular pipelines by reducing information loss and error accumulation, with significant potential to enhance both mobility and safety.

item.title: Word Level Timestamp Generation for Automatic Speech Recognition and Translation
item.description: We introduce a data-driven approach for enabling word-level timestamp prediction in the Canary model.

item.title: SNAP: A Benchmark for Testing the Effects of Capture Conditions on Fundamental Vision Tasks
item.description: Lastly, we conduct an experiment to establish a human baseline for the VQA task.

item.title: Oral Imaging for Malocclusion Issues Assessments: OMNI Dataset, Deep Learning Baselines and Benchmarking
item.description: Malocclusion is a major challenge in orthodontics, and its complex presentation and diverse clinical manifestations make accurate localization and diagnosis particularly important.

item.title: Distance Adaptive Beam Search for Provably Accurate Graph-Based Nearest Neighbor Search
item.description: We prove that, as long as the search graph is navigable, our resulting Adaptive Beam Search method is guaranteed to approximately solve the nearest-neighbor problem, establishing a connection between navigability and the performance of graph-based search.

item.title: Aligning Explanations with Human Communication
item.description: However, these methods generally ignore the communicative context of explanation-the ability of the user to understand the prediction of the model from the explanation.

item.title: Soft Thinking: Unlocking the Reasoning Potential of LLMs in Continuous Concept Space
item.description: In this work, we introduce Soft Thinking, a training-free method that emulates human-like "soft" reasoning by generating soft, abstract concept tokens in a continuous concept space.

item.title: Learn to Reason Efficiently with Adaptive Length-based Reward Shaping
item.description: Large Reasoning Models (LRMs) have shown remarkable capabilities in solving complex problems through reinforcement learning (RL), particularly by generating long reasoning traces.

item.title: Bayesian Ensembling: Insights from Online Optimization and Empirical Bayes
item.description: We revisit the classical problem of Bayesian ensembles and address the challenge of learning optimal combinations of Bayesian models in an online, continual learning setting.

item.title: HAVA: Hybrid Approach to Value-Alignment through Reward Weighing for Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Many of the norms are written as laws or rules (legal / safety norms) but even more remain unwritten (social norms).

item.title: The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Entropy Minimization in LLM Reasoning
item.description: Entropy minimization (EM) trains the model to concentrate even more probability mass on its most confident outputs.

item.title: Modular Jump Gaussian Processes
item.description: Gaussian processes (GPs) furnish accurate nonlinear predictions with well-calibrated uncertainty.

item.title: ClickSight: Interpreting Student Clickstreams to Reveal Insights on Learning Strategies via LLMs
item.description: ClickSight demonstrates the potential of LLMs to generate theory-driven insights from educational interaction data.

item.title: UWSAM: Segment Anything Model Guided Underwater Instance Segmentation and A Large-scale Benchmark Dataset
item.description: With recent breakthroughs in large-scale modeling, the Segment Anything Model (SAM) has demonstrated significant potential in a variety of visual applications.

item.title: Laplace Sample Information: Data Informativeness Through a Bayesian Lens
item.description: Accurately estimating the informativeness of individual samples in a dataset is an important objective in deep learning, as it can guide sample selection, which can improve model efficiency and accuracy by removing redundant or potentially harmful samples.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Conformal Prediction Under Local Differential Privacy
item.description: In the first approach, users do not access the model but instead provide their input features and a perturbed label using a k-ary randomized response.

item.title: Audio Jailbreak: An Open Comprehensive Benchmark for Jailbreaking Large Audio-Language Models
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce AJailBench, the first benchmark specifically designed to evaluate jailbreak vulnerabilities in LAMs.

item.title: Exploring LLM-Generated Feedback for Economics Essays: How Teaching Assistants Evaluate and Envision Its Use
item.description: For a randomly selected set of essays that they had graded, we used our feedback engine to generate feedback and displayed the feedback as in-text comments in a Word document.

item.title: The Devil is in Fine-tuning and Long-tailed Problems:A New Benchmark for Scene Text Detection
item.description: First, a \textit{Fine-tuning Gap}, where models leverage \textit{Dataset-Specific Optimization} (DSO) paradigm for one domain at the cost of reduced effectiveness in others, leads to inflated performances on academic benchmarks.

item.title: From Problem-Solving to Teaching Problem-Solving: Aligning LLMs with Pedagogy using Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) can transform education, but their optimization for direct question-answering often undermines effective pedagogy which requires strategically withholding answers.

item.title: Stronger ViTs With Octic Equivariance
item.description: Recent efforts at scaling computer vision models have established Vision Transformers (ViTs) as the leading architecture.

item.title: Toward Informed AV Decision-Making: Computational Model of Well-being and Trust in Mobility
item.description: Specifically, our model captures the well-being of both an AV user and an interacting road user as cognitive states alongside trust.
